GREAT IMPROVEMENT in HYDRAULIC RAMS. 

The subscriber, during the past six years of practical experience 
 in piittinir up H\<iraulic Rams has seen the necessity of some im- 
 proveuR-nt, and would now most respeclfully say to the communi-

 convenient, with greater nicrtv and no possible danger of getting.5 
 oat ul uider ; and uuuUicr new feuture is the enameling or coatin

Terms— Cash, or approved notes, or acceptances with interest 
 payable witliin four months, in Albany, New York, Boston, I'bil 
 adelphia. or Baltimore, as may best suit the purchaser. 

All artices warranted made of good materials, and to operate as 
 represented, oi may be returned within three months, at the ex- 
 pense of manufacturers for home transportation, and purchase- 
 money refunded — the ))urchaser being his own judge in each ca.se

 subscribes. Liberal deductions to dealers. Local Agents wanted 
 to sell and put the above in operation. EMERY &; CO. 

June, 1S52. 369 & 371 Broadway, Albany, N. Y. 

he inside surface of the Ram with glass, thereby preserving it 
 from rust, making it (with water-proof paint upon the outside; al- 
 most imperishable. These Rams are warranted to be more durable 
 than any others made in the United States, without any exception) 

Gatchel's Double Acting Rains, have become very valualile is 
 raising spring or well water, by means of a cree^i. These Rams 
 with suitable Pipes will be put iiown, (and warranted for one year 
 at the lowest possible price for cash. 

Gatchel's Rams w^ill be put up (when preferred) as usual, by the 
 S'.'bscriber, who has erected large numbers of them in various partsn 
 of the country. 

As to the quantity of water elevated by the above ram, a chal- 
 lenge for not less than One Hundred Dollars is still open, to any 
 or all of those persons who alledge that their rams will elevate u 
 greater amount or per cent of water. The truth is that a certain 
 per cent of water may be raised by the ram, according to known 
 'aws of mechanics and philosophy, and he ^vho pretends to raise 
 more may be set down as an arrant humbug, and intending to de- 
 ceive the public. 

Farmers and others wanting Rams will subserve their interest 
 by examining the above Rams before purchasing elsewhere (one 
 may be seen in practical operation at the store at any time.) 

Pipes of a, I kinds furnished, and contracts for plumbing at the 
 lowest rates for Cash. A large variety of pumps, with pipes to suit, 
 always on hand. 

The subscriber would also call the attention of the public to an 
 article of Lightning Rod, constructed upon the principles laid 
 down by Professor Hare, Farady, Dr. Franklin, Z-ardner, Arago, 
 \V. Snow Harris, F. R. S , and other philosophers, who have writ- 
 ten on this subject. 

They are cheap, effective and highly approved of by all who see 
 them. Call and examine for yourselves. A. C. BROWN,
